docs.title: Welcome to PGx Toolkit
docs.text: PGx Toolkit is a Python package designed for personalized pharmacogenomic network analysis. It bridges the gap between raw genotype data and pharmacogenomic knowledge bases to uncover actionable insights through network science.

docs.title: Key Features
docs.text:
• Genotype Parsing: Efficiently reads 23andMe raw data formats.
  • Annotation Mapping: Links variants to PharmGKB drug annotations.
  • Network Construction: Builds a graph where nodes are Genes and Drugs, and edges represent pharmacogenomic interactions.
  • Centrality Analysis: Identifies key drivers in your personal pharmacogenomic landscape.

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text:
To install the package:

pip install .

See the API Reference for detailed usage.

docs.title: Annotation Module
docs.text: ::: pgx_toolkit.core.annotation handler: python options: members: - PharmGKB - DrugAnnotation

docs.title: Genotype Module
docs.text: ::: pgx_toolkit.core.genotype handler: python options: members: - UserGenotype - GenotypeEntry

docs.title: Matcher Module
docs.text: ::: pgx_toolkit.core.matcher handler: python options: members: - PGxMatcher - MatchedVariant

docs.title: Network Analysis Module
docs.text: ::: pgx_toolkit.analysis.network handler: python options: members: - InteractionNetwork

docs.title: Visualization Module
docs.text: ::: pgx_toolkit.viz.graph_plot handler: python options: members: - plot_network
